exercises.question: Which phrasal verb describes becoming exhausted and unable to work due to excessive stress or overwork?
exercises.hint: Think of a candle that has used up all its wax and can no longer produce a flame.
exercises.example_sentence: The engineers will likely burn out unless the management reduces the current overtime requirements.

exercises.question: The laboratory technician must ___ the experiments precisely; therefore, the final data will be reliable for the publication.
exercises.hint: Choose the phrasal verb that means to perform or complete a task, instruction, or research.
exercises.example_sentence: The laboratory technician must carry out the experiments precisely; therefore, the final data will be reliable for the publication.

exercises.question: Match the work-related phrasal verbs with their closer descriptive academic or formal synonyms.
exercises.hint: One pair is about starting to work hard; the other is about gaining responsibility for a department or role.
exercises.example_sentence: We need to knuckle down on this report before the new manager arrives to take over the department.

exercises.question: Order the sentence regarding a temporary work substitution.
exercises.answer: The assistant will fill in for the director unless an interim replacement is hired before the conference
exercises.hint: Start with 'The assistant' and use 'unless' to define the condition that would stop the substitution.
exercises.example_sentence: The assistant will fill in for the director unless an interim replacement is hired before the conference.

exercises.question: Say 'productivity'.
exercises.hint: Stress the fourth syllable: pro-duc-TIV-i-ty. This refers to the efficiency of individual or collective work.
exercises.example_sentence: Company productivity has increased significantly although the total number of staff remained constant.

exercises.question: Which phrasal verb means to cancel an event or an agreement that was previously planned?
exercises.hint: Think of stopping a search or a meeting because it is no longer possible or necessary.
exercises.example_sentence: They had to call off the merger although the initial negotiations had been very positive.

exercises.question: She worked through the weekend to ___ in her career; whereas, her peers preferred to maintain a strict work-life balance.
exercises.hint: Choose the phrasal verb that means to be successful or to make more progress than others.
exercises.example_sentence: She worked through the weekend to get ahead in her career; whereas, her peers preferred to maintain a strict work-life balance.

exercises.question: Match the phrasal verbs with their closer descriptive formal synonyms.
exercises.hint: One pair is about writing a formal document; the other is about gradually ending an activity or operation.
exercises.example_sentence: The lawyers will draw up the contract as the current project begins to wind down next month.

exercises.question: Order the sentence for a project debrief report.
exercises.answer: Notwithstanding the immense pressure the team did not burn out although the project lasted eight months
exercises.hint: Start with 'Notwithstanding' and use 'although' to contrast the duration of the project with the team's resilience.
exercises.example_sentence: Notwithstanding the immense pressure, the team did not burn out although the project lasted eight months.

exercises.question: Say 'efficiency'.
exercises.hint: Stress the second syllable: ef-FI-cien-cy. This refers to the state of achieving maximum productivity with minimum wasted effort.
exercises.example_sentence: The new software will improve operational efficiency unless the hardware is too outdated to run it.

exercises.question: Which phrasal verb means to submit a piece of work or a document to someone in authority?
exercises.hint: Think of giving your homework to a teacher or a resignation letter to a boss.
exercises.example_sentence: You must hand in your expense reports by Friday although the finance office is closed on weekends.

exercises.question: We should not ___ the decision any longer; therefore, we will hold a vote during the emergency meeting tonight.
exercises.hint: Choose the phrasal verb that means to delay or postpone doing something.
exercises.example_sentence: We should not put off the decision any longer; therefore, we will hold a vote during the emergency meeting tonight.

exercises.question: Match the phrasal verbs with their closer descriptive academic synonyms.
exercises.hint: One pair is about moving at the same speed as others; the other is about failing to stay on schedule.
exercises.example_sentence: If we don't keep up with technology trends, we will eventually fall behind our competitors.

exercises.question: Order the sentence regarding company expansion limits.
exercises.answer: The department will not take on new clients unless the current backlog is fully resolved by July
exercises.hint: Start with 'The department' and use 'unless' to set a condition for accepting more work.
exercises.example_sentence: The department will not take on new clients unless the current backlog is fully resolved by July.

exercises.question: Say 'implementation'.
exercises.hint: Stress the fourth syllable: im-ple-men-TA-tion. This is the process of putting a decision or plan into effect.
exercises.example_sentence: The implementation of the new policy was seamless whereas the previous transition had been chaotic.

exercises.question: Which phrasal verb means to resign from a high position or a job?
exercises.hint: Think of a leader 'descending' from their platform to let someone else lead.
exercises.example_sentence: The CEO decided to step down although the company's stock price was at an all-time high.

exercises.question: They were able to ___ a new branch in London; therefore, the firm's presence in Europe has doubled this year.
exercises.hint: Choose the phrasal verb that means to establish or start a business, organization, or system.
exercises.example_sentence: They were able to set up a new branch in London; therefore, the firm's presence in Europe has doubled this year.

exercises.question: Match the phrasal verbs with their closer descriptive meanings.
exercises.hint: One pair is about being lazy or working with less effort; the other is about doing work you missed to get back on schedule.
exercises.example_sentence: If you slack off now, you will have to work through the night to catch up with the rest of the team.

exercises.question: Order the sentence for a software release summary.
exercises.answer: Notwithstanding the technical glitches the developer managed to follow through with the deployment successfully
exercises.hint: Start with 'Notwithstanding' and use 'follow through' to mean completing the task despite the obstacles.
exercises.example_sentence: Notwithstanding the technical glitches, the developer managed to follow through with the deployment successfully.

exercises.question: Say 'specialization'.
exercises.hint: Stress the fifth syllable: spe-cial-i-ZA-tion. This refers to the process of concentrating on and becoming expert in a particular subject or skill.
exercises.example_sentence: Increased specialization within the workforce is necessary unless we want to remain a general service provider.

exercises.question: Which phrasal verb means to change or develop into something different?
exercises.hint: Think of a caterpillar becoming a butterfly or a small startup becoming a global corporation.
exercises.example_sentence: The small pilot project could turn into a major revenue stream although the initial investment was quite modest.

exercises.question: The company decided to ___ the older machinery over the next two years; therefore, we must begin training staff on the new digital systems immediately.
exercises.hint: Choose the phrasal verb that means to gradually stop using something or to bring something to an end in stages.
exercises.example_sentence: The company decided to phase out the older machinery over the next two years; therefore, we must begin training staff on the new digital systems immediately.

exercises.question: Match the phrasal verbs related to change with their closer descriptive academic synonyms.
exercises.hint: One pair is about starting an organization or system; the other is about making something happen.
exercises.example_sentence: The new legislation will bring about significant changes once the government helps set up the regulatory body.

exercises.question: Order the sentence to describe a natural process of development.
exercises.answer: The caterpillar will not transform into a butterfly unless it undergoes a complete metamorphosis inside the chrysalis
exercises.hint: Start with 'The caterpillar' and use 'unless' to indicate the required condition for change.
exercises.example_sentence: The caterpillar will not transform into a butterfly unless it undergoes a complete metamorphosis inside the chrysalis.

exercises.question: Say 'modernization'.
exercises.hint: Stress the fourth syllable: mod-ern-i-ZA-tion. This refers to the process of adapting something to modern needs or habits.
exercises.example_sentence: The modernization of the factory is essential although the costs involved are quite substantial for a medium-sized enterprise.

exercises.question: Which phrasal verb means to start to like something or someone more than you did at first?
exercises.hint: Think of a song or a new office layout that you disliked initially but now enjoy.
exercises.example_sentence: The new software interface will grow on you over time although the layout seems counterintuitive at first glance.

exercises.question: We must ___ our previous successes; therefore, we are launching an even more ambitious campaign this quarter.
exercises.hint: Choose the phrasal verb that means to use something as a base for further development.
exercises.example_sentence: We must build on our previous successes; therefore, we are launching an even more ambitious campaign this quarter.

exercises.question: Match the phrasal verbs describing development states with their formal synonyms.
exercises.hint: One pair is about making a sudden discovery or progress; the other is about resources or ideas coming to an end.
exercises.example_sentence: Funding might dry up quickly unless the researchers manage to break through the current technical barriers.

exercises.question: Order the sentence to describe a company expanding its focus.
exercises.answer: Notwithstanding the economic downturn the industry is branching out into renewable energy solutions aggressively
exercises.hint: Start with 'Notwithstanding' to contrast the bad economy with the industry's expansion.
exercises.example_sentence: Notwithstanding the economic downturn, the industry is branching out into renewable energy solutions aggressively.

exercises.question: Say 'diversification'.
exercises.hint: Stress the fifth syllable: di-ver-si-fi-CA-tion. This refers to the process of a business enlarging or varying its range of products or field of operation.
exercises.example_sentence: Market diversification is a sound strategy whereas relying on a single product often leads to financial instability.

exercises.question: Which phrasal verb means to fail to happen, typically used for plans, deals, or arrangements?
exercises.hint: Think of a contract that 'drops' between the cracks and disappears.
exercises.example_sentence: The real estate deal is likely to fall through unless the buyer secures a loan by the end of the business day.

exercises.question: We expect the prototype to ___ a fully functional consumer product; whereas, the current version is strictly for internal testing.
exercises.hint: Choose the phrasal verb that means to develop gradually into a more complex or advanced state.
exercises.example_sentence: We expect the prototype to evolve into a fully functional consumer product; whereas, the current version is strictly for internal testing.

exercises.question: Match the phrasal verbs related to stages of development with their descriptive meanings.
exercises.hint: One pair is about a trend starting to be accepted; the other is about bringing an activity or a speech to an end.
exercises.example_sentence: The new payment method took months to catch on, but we finally managed to wind up the marketing campaign successfully.

exercises.question: Order the sentence regarding urban development.
exercises.answer: The city will tear down the old stadium unless the historical society can prove its architectural significance
exercises.hint: Start with 'The city' and use 'unless' to describe the condition to stop the demolition.
exercises.example_sentence: The city will tear down the old stadium unless the historical society can prove its architectural significance.

exercises.question: Say 'industrialization'.
exercises.hint: Stress the sixth syllable: in-dus-tri-al-i-ZA-tion. This is the development of industries in a country or region on a wide scale.
exercises.example_sentence: Rapid industrialization brought economic growth although it also caused significant environmental degradation in the surrounding areas.

exercises.question: Which phrasal verb means to suddenly become very successful or popular?
exercises.hint: Think of an airplane leaving the ground or a viral video getting millions of views in an hour.
exercises.example_sentence: The startup's sales began to take off although they had almost no budget for traditional advertising.

exercises.question: It is time for the committee to ___ to the next agenda item; therefore, we must conclude this discussion on personnel immediately.
exercises.hint: Choose the phrasal verb that means to start doing or discussing something new after finishing something else.
exercises.example_sentence: It is time for the committee to move on to the next agenda item; therefore, we must conclude this discussion on personnel immediately.

exercises.question: Match the phrasal verbs describing changes in project scope with their closer formal synonyms.
exercises.hint: One pair is about starting an event or project; the other is about making a plan smaller or less expensive than originally intended.
exercises.example_sentence: We will kick off the meeting at noon, but we might have to scale back our ambitions for the final project.

exercises.question: Order the sentence for a corporate progress report.
exercises.answer: Notwithstanding the slow start the new policy is beginning to pay off as evidenced by the recent increase in efficiency
exercises.hint: Start with 'Notwithstanding' and use 'pay off' to mean that the strategy is finally producing good results.
exercises.example_sentence: Notwithstanding the slow start, the new policy is beginning to pay off as evidenced by the recent increase in efficiency.

exercises.question: Say 'transformation'.
exercises.hint: Stress the third syllable: trans-for-MA-tion. This refers to a thorough or dramatic change in form or appearance.
exercises.example_sentence: The digital transformation of the industry is inevitable unless we choose to become obsolete in the modern marketplace.

exercises.question: Which phrasal verb means to leave the ground and begin to fly, or to become suddenly successful?
exercises.hint: Think of an aircraft departing or a new business venture becoming an overnight sensation.
exercises.example_sentence: The new product line is expected to take off although the marketing budget was significantly reduced this quarter.

exercises.question: Sales figures usually ___ during the holiday season; therefore, we must prepare the warehouse for increased inventory levels.
exercises.hint: Choose the phrasal verb that means to increase or improve after a slow period.
exercises.example_sentence: Sales figures usually pick up during the holiday season; therefore, we must prepare the warehouse for increased inventory levels.

exercises.question: Match the phrasal verbs involving movement/discovery with their academic synonyms.
exercises.hint: One pair is about examining something carefully; the other is about finding something by chance.
exercises.example_sentence: We should go over the files again in case we come across the missing invoice from last month.

exercises.question: Order the sentence to describe a public transport condition.
exercises.answer: The commuters will get on the train unless the platform becomes dangerously overcrowded during the rush hour
exercises.hint: Start with 'The commuters' and use 'unless' to show the condition that would stop them from boarding.
exercises.example_sentence: The commuters will get on the train unless the platform becomes dangerously overcrowded during the rush hour.

exercises.question: Say 'acceleration'.
exercises.hint: Stress the fourth syllable: ac-cel-er-A-tion. This refers to the rate of increase in speed or velocity.
exercises.example_sentence: The acceleration of the digital economy is undeniable although many traditional sectors are struggling to adapt.

exercises.question: Which phrasal verb means to stop functioning (for a machine) or to lose emotional control?
exercises.hint: Think of a car engine failing on a highway or a complex negotiation failing due to lack of trust.
exercises.example_sentence: The old delivery truck will likely break down unless it receives a comprehensive mechanical inspection soon.

exercises.question: The hikers were forced to ___ due to the blizzard; whereas, the original plan was to reach the summit by noon.
exercises.hint: Choose the phrasal verb that means to return in the direction you came from because of an obstacle.
exercises.example_sentence: The hikers were forced to turn back due to the blizzard; whereas, the original plan was to reach the summit by noon.

exercises.question: Match the movement phrasal verbs with their descriptive meanings.
exercises.hint: One pair is about starting a journey; the other is about meeting someone by accident.
exercises.example_sentence: We plan to set off early so that we don't run into heavy traffic on the main motorway.

exercises.question: Order the sentence for a flight safety report.
exercises.answer: Notwithstanding the mechanical failure the pilot brought the plane down safely although the landing was extremely turbulent
exercises.hint: Start with 'Notwithstanding' and use 'although' to contrast the safe result with the scary process.
exercises.example_sentence: Notwithstanding the mechanical failure, the pilot brought the plane down safely although the landing was extremely turbulent.

exercises.question: Say 'orientation'.
exercises.hint: Stress the fourth syllable: o-ri-en-TA-tion. This refers to the relative position or direction of something.
exercises.example_sentence: The orientation of the building allows for maximum sunlight whereas the previous design was far less efficient.

exercises.question: Which phrasal verb means to escape or leave a place, especially for a holiday?
exercises.hint: Think of leaving the city for a quiet weekend in the mountains.
exercises.example_sentence: We hope to get away for a few days although the current project requires our constant supervision.

exercises.question: The vessel will ___ the harbor at dawn; therefore, the crew must complete all safety checks before midnight.
exercises.hint: Choose the phrasal verb that means to move in a particular direction.
exercises.example_sentence: The vessel will head for the harbor at dawn; therefore, the crew must complete all safety checks before midnight.

exercises.question: Match the driving-related phrasal verbs with their descriptive meanings.
exercises.hint: One pair is about going faster; the other is about moving to the side of the road to stop.
exercises.example_sentence: The police asked him to pull over because he did not speed up sufficiently when merging onto the highway.

exercises.question: Order the sentence regarding logistics.
exercises.answer: The delivery will not show up on time unless the courier finds a faster route through the city center
exercises.hint: Start with 'The delivery' and use 'unless' to specify the condition for on-time arrival.
exercises.example_sentence: The delivery will not show up on time unless the courier finds a faster route through the city center.

exercises.question: Say 'fluctuation'.
exercises.hint: Stress the third syllable: fluc-tu-A-tion. This refers to an irregular rising and falling in number or amount.
exercises.example_sentence: The fluctuation in fuel prices is constant although the global demand remains relatively stable.

exercises.question: Which phrasal verb means to visit a place and look at the things in it?
exercises.hint: Think of a tourist exploring a museum or a potential buyer inspecting a house.
exercises.example_sentence: We had some time to look around the factory although the official tour was not scheduled until later.

exercises.question: The old bridge is starting to ___; therefore, the local council has prohibited heavy vehicles from crossing it.
exercises.hint: Choose the phrasal verb that means to break into pieces because of being old or badly made.
exercises.example_sentence: The old bridge is starting to fall apart; therefore, the local council has prohibited heavy vehicles from crossing it.

exercises.question: Match the logistical phrasal verbs with their descriptive academic synonyms.
exercises.hint: One pair is about bringing something to a destination; the other is about going to get something.
exercises.example_sentence: I need to drop off the reports at the office before I pick up the clients from the airport.

exercises.question: Order the sentence to describe a difficult mission.
exercises.answer: Notwithstanding the heavy snowfall the rescue team pushed on towards the stranded climbers successfully
exercises.hint: Start with 'Notwithstanding' and use 'pushed on' to show they continued despite the weather.
exercises.example_sentence: Notwithstanding the heavy snowfall, the rescue team pushed on towards the stranded climbers successfully.

exercises.question: Say 'transportation'.
exercises.hint: Stress the fourth syllable: trans-por-TA-tion. This is the action of transporting someone or something or the process of being transported.
exercises.example_sentence: Public transportation is efficient in the capital whereas rural areas suffer from a complete lack of connectivity.

exercises.question: Which adjective describes a method of using resources so that they are not permanently damaged or depleted?
exercises.hint: Think of 'green' energy or agricultural practices that can continue indefinitely without harming the planet.
exercises.example_sentence: The government must invest in sustainable energy sources although the initial costs of infrastructure are quite high.

exercises.question: The loss of ___ in the rainforest is a global concern; therefore, international organizations are working to protect endangered species.
exercises.hint: Choose the noun that refers to the variety of plant and animal life in a particular habitat.
exercises.example_sentence: The loss of biodiversity in the rainforest is a global concern; therefore, international organizations are working to protect endangered species.

exercises.question: Match the environmental verbs with their academic synonyms.
exercises.hint: One pair is about making something dirty or poisonous; the other is about saving or protecting natural resources.
exercises.example_sentence: Industrial waste can quickly contaminate the local water supply unless we take active steps to conserve our natural springs.

exercises.question: Order the sentence regarding environmental recovery.
exercises.answer: The ecosystem will not recover unless the illegal logging is permanently halted by the local authorities
exercises.hint: Start with 'The ecosystem' and use 'unless' to define the critical condition for nature to heal.
exercises.example_sentence: The ecosystem will not recover unless the illegal logging is permanently halted by the local authorities.

exercises.question: Say 'deforestation'.
exercises.hint: Stress the fourth syllable: de-for-es-TA-tion. This refers to the action of clearing a wide area of trees.
exercises.example_sentence: The rate of deforestation has increased significantly although global awareness of climate change is at an all-time high.

exercises.question: Which noun refers to the production and discharge of something, especially gas or radiation?
exercises.hint: Think of carbon dioxide coming from cars or factories.
exercises.example_sentence: The city aims to reduce carbon emissions by fifty percent whereas neighboring regions have not yet set clear targets.

exercises.question: We must transition toward ___ energy sources; therefore, the dependency on fossil fuels will gradually decrease over time.
exercises.hint: Choose the adjective for energy from a source that is not depleted when used, such as wind or solar power.
exercises.example_sentence: We must transition toward renewable energy sources; therefore, the dependency on fossil fuels will gradually decrease over time.

exercises.question: Match the nouns describing environmental changes with their academic synonyms.
exercises.hint: One pair is about a resource becoming less or empty; the other is about something increasing or gathering over time.
exercises.example_sentence: The depletion of the ozone layer is linked to the accumulation of certain chemicals in the upper atmosphere.

exercises.question: Order the sentence for a report on environmental policy.
exercises.answer: Notwithstanding the scientific consensus the proposed environmental regulations were met with fierce opposition from the industrial lobby
exercises.hint: Start with 'Notwithstanding' to contrast the facts (consensus) with the political reaction (opposition).
exercises.example_sentence: Notwithstanding the scientific consensus, the proposed environmental regulations were met with fierce opposition from the industrial lobby.

exercises.question: Say 'contaminant'.
exercises.hint: Stress the second syllable: con-TAM-i-nant. This refers to a polluting or poisonous substance that makes something impure.
exercises.example_sentence: The researchers found a dangerous contaminant in the soil although the site had been closed for decades.

exercises.question: Which adjective describes something that causes great and sudden damage or suffering?
exercises.hint: Often used to describe the effects of floods, earthquakes, or severe climate change.
exercises.example_sentence: The impact of the flood was catastrophic although the community had attempted to build temporary defenses.

exercises.question: Coastal cities are highly ___ to rising sea levels; whereas, inland regions are primarily concerned with drought and heatwaves.
exercises.hint: Choose the adjective that means susceptible to physical or emotional attack or harm.
exercises.example_sentence: Coastal cities are highly vulnerable to rising sea levels; whereas, inland regions are primarily concerned with drought and heatwaves.

exercises.question: Match the scientific verbs with their descriptive academic synonyms.
exercises.hint: One pair is about making a bad situation better; the other is about making a bad situation even worse.
exercises.example_sentence: New irrigation techniques can mitigate the effects of drought, but over-farming might exacerbate the soil erosion.

exercises.question: Order the sentence for a conservation strategy document.
exercises.answer: The wildlife population will decline unless we establish a protected corridor between the two national parks
exercises.hint: Start with 'The wildlife' and use 'unless' to show what must be done to prevent the decline.
exercises.example_sentence: The wildlife population will decline unless we establish a protected corridor between the two national parks.

exercises.question: Say 'sustainability'.
exercises.hint: Stress the fifth syllable: sus-tain-a-BIL-i-ty. This is the ability to be maintained at a certain rate or level.
exercises.example_sentence: Long-term environmental sustainability is impossible unless we reduce our global consumption of plastic.

exercises.question: Which noun refers to the natural home or environment of an animal, plant, or other organism?
exercises.hint: Think of the ocean for a whale or the forest for a bear.
exercises.example_sentence: Urban expansion is destroying the natural habitat of many birds although local parks provide some refuge.

exercises.question: The factory must dispose of ___ waste properly; therefore, a specialized disposal unit has been hired to manage the process.
exercises.hint: Choose the adjective that means risky or dangerous, especially to health or safety.
exercises.example_sentence: The factory must dispose of hazardous waste properly; therefore, a specialized disposal unit has been hired to manage the process.

exercises.question: Match the landscape adjectives with their descriptive meanings.
exercises.hint: One pair is about a land that has little or no rain; the other is about land that is capable of producing abundant vegetation or crops.
exercises.example_sentence: It is difficult to farm in arid regions, but the valley remains fertile due to its proximity to the river.

exercises.question: Order the sentence for a scientific observation report.
exercises.answer: Notwithstanding the record temperatures the glacier is melting faster than predicted although some areas remain permanently frozen
exercises.hint: Start with 'Notwithstanding' and use 'although' to contrast the fast melting with the few frozen spots.
exercises.example_sentence: Notwithstanding the record temperatures, the glacier is melting faster than predicted although some areas remain permanently frozen.

exercises.question: Say 'environmentalist'.
exercises.hint: Stress the fifth syllable: en-vi-ron-men-TAL-ist. This is a person who is concerned with or advocates for the protection of the environment.
exercises.example_sentence: She became a prominent environmentalist after witnessing the damage caused by the oil spill in the gulf.

exercises.question: Which noun refers to the suppression or prohibition of any parts of books, films, or news that are considered obscene or politically unacceptable?
exercises.hint: Think of a government or organization preventing certain information from being shared with the public.
exercises.example_sentence: The government faced international criticism for its strict censorship although it claimed the measures were for national security.

exercises.question: There is ___ concern regarding the rise of fake news; therefore, social media platforms are implementing stricter verification processes.
exercises.hint: Choose the adjective that means found or distributed over a large area or among many people.
exercises.example_sentence: There is widespread concern regarding the rise of fake news; therefore, social media platforms are implementing stricter verification processes.

exercises.question: Match the media and ethics terms with their closer academic synonyms.
exercises.hint: One pair is about having an unfair preference for something; the other is about remaining neutral and fair.
exercises.example_sentence: Journalists must remain objective unless they are writing an opinion piece where a certain amount of bias is expected.

exercises.question: Order the sentence regarding journalistic ethics.
exercises.answer: The editor will not publish the story unless the journalist can provide two independent sources to verify the claims
exercises.hint: Start with 'The editor' and use 'unless' to define the ethical requirement for publication.
exercises.example_sentence: The editor will not publish the story unless the journalist can provide two independent sources to verify the claims.

exercises.question: Say 'investigative'.
exercises.hint: Stress the second syllable: in-VES-ti-ga-tive. This refers to journalism that uncovers facts the public didn't know about.
exercises.example_sentence: High-quality investigative journalism is essential for a healthy democracy although it requires significant time and resources.

exercises.question: Which noun refers to the fact or condition of being required or expected to justify actions or decisions?
exercises.hint: Think of politicians or public figures being held responsible for their actions.
exercises.example_sentence: Public demand for accountability has grown whereas many corporations still prioritize profit over transparency.

exercises.question: The senator made a ___ statement about immigration policy; consequently, the debate in the media became extremely heated.
exercises.hint: Choose the adjective that describes something likely to give rise to public disagreement.
exercises.example_sentence: The senator made a controversial statement about immigration policy; consequently, the debate in the media became extremely heated.

exercises.question: Match the ethical and media terms with their descriptive meanings.
exercises.hint: One pair is about high moral principles; the other is about biased information used to promote a political cause.
exercises.example_sentence: A news outlet must maintain its integrity so as to avoid being labeled as a source of propaganda.

exercises.question: Order the sentence for a media industry report.
exercises.answer: Notwithstanding the vocal protests the network broadcast the documentary although it had been heavily edited to avoid legal action
exercises.hint: Start with 'Notwithstanding' to contrast the protests with the fact that the show aired anyway.
exercises.example_sentence: Notwithstanding the vocal protests, the network broadcast the documentary although it had been heavily edited to avoid legal action.

exercises.question: Say 'transparency'.
exercises.hint: Stress the second syllable: trans-PAR-en-cy. This refers to the quality of being open and without secrets.
exercises.example_sentence: The public demands more transparency in government spending unless the information is deemed top-secret for safety.

exercises.question: Which noun refers to the use of exciting or shocking stories or language at the expense of accuracy, in order to provoke public interest?
exercises.hint: Think of clickbait headlines or exaggerated news reports designed to get more viewers.
exercises.example_sentence: The tabloids are often criticized for their sensationalism although they remain the most widely read newspapers in the country.

exercises.question: It is not ___ for a reporter to accept gifts from a source; whereas, building a professional relationship is generally encouraged.
exercises.hint: Choose the adjective relating to moral principles or the branch of knowledge dealing with these.
exercises.example_sentence: It is not ethical for a reporter to accept gifts from a source; whereas, building a professional relationship is generally encouraged.

exercises.question: Match the social verbs with their academic synonyms.
exercises.hint: One pair is about looking at something very carefully to find mistakes; the other is about publicly recommending a cause or policy.
exercises.example_sentence: The public will scrutinize the new laws while many groups continue to advocate for human rights.

exercises.question: Order the sentence regarding legal and ethical liability.
exercises.answer: The company will be held liable unless it can prove that the data breach was the result of an unforeseeable cyber attack
exercises.hint: Start with 'The company' and use 'unless' to indicate the only condition that would excuse them from responsibility.
exercises.example_sentence: The company will be held liable unless it can prove that the data breach was the result of an unforeseeable cyber attack.

exercises.question: Say 'globalization'.
exercises.hint: Stress the fifth syllable: glob-al-i-ZA-tion. This refers to the process of international integration arising from the interchange of world views.
exercises.example_sentence: Rapid globalization has led to cultural exchange although it has also caused the decline of some local traditions.

exercises.question: Which noun refers to laws, considered collectively?
exercises.hint: Think of the rules made by a parliament or a governing body.
exercises.example_sentence: New legislation is required to protect digital privacy whereas current laws are outdated and insufficient.

exercises.question: Cynicism toward mainstream media is becoming more ___ among younger generations; therefore, alternative news sources are thriving.
exercises.hint: Choose the adjective that means widespread in a particular area or at a particular time.
exercises.example_sentence: Cynicism toward mainstream media is becoming more prevalent among younger generations; therefore, alternative news sources are thriving.

exercises.question: Match the social and media verbs with their closer descriptive meanings.
exercises.hint: One pair is about making secret information known; the other is about controlling or influencing a person or situation cleverly or unfairly.
exercises.example_sentence: The journalist refused to disclose her sources, fearing that the government would try to manipulate the public narrative.

exercises.question: Order the sentence for a television industry update.
exercises.answer: Notwithstanding the high ratings the show was canceled due to ethical concerns about the treatment of its participants
exercises.hint: Start with 'Notwithstanding' to contrast the popularity of the show with the reason it was stopped.
exercises.example_sentence: Notwithstanding the high ratings, the show was canceled due to ethical concerns about the treatment of its participants.

exercises.question: Say 'discrimination'.
exercises.hint: Stress the fourth syllable: dis-crim-i-NA-tion. This refers to the unjust or prejudicial treatment of different categories of people.
exercises.example_sentence: The new policy aims to eliminate discrimination in the workplace although cultural biases still persist.

exercises.question: Which adjective describes the most advanced and newest stage in the development of a particular technology?
exercises.hint: Think of the very latest smartphone or a breakthrough in medical science.
exercises.example_sentence: The laboratory uses cutting-edge equipment although the funding for new research has been limited this year.

exercises.question: The factory introduced ___ to increase production speed; therefore, the need for manual labor has decreased by forty percent.
exercises.hint: Choose the noun that refers to the use of largely automatic equipment in a system of manufacturing or other production process.
exercises.example_sentence: The factory introduced automation to increase production speed; therefore, the need for manual labor has decreased by forty percent.

exercises.question: Match the technology-related adjectives with their closer academic synonyms.
exercises.hint: One pair is about something that is no longer useful; the other is about a new idea that changes everything.
exercises.example_sentence: We must replace the obsolete software unless we want to fall behind our more innovative competitors.

exercises.question: Order the sentence regarding IT maintenance.
exercises.answer: The system will not function correctly unless the latest security patches are installed by the administrator
exercises.hint: Start with 'The system' and use 'unless' to define the technical requirement for functionality.
exercises.example_sentence: The system will not function correctly unless the latest security patches are installed by the administrator.

exercises.question: Say 'infrastructure'.
exercises.hint: Stress the first syllable: IN-fra-struc-ture. This refers to the basic physical and organizational structures needed for the operation of a society or enterprise.
exercises.example_sentence: Investing in digital infrastructure is a priority whereas the physical roads still require significant repairs.

exercises.question: Which noun refers to a sudden, dramatic, and important discovery or development?
exercises.hint: Often used in science or medicine when a major problem is finally solved.
exercises.example_sentence: The recent breakthrough in battery technology could double the range of electric vehicles although testing is still ongoing.

exercises.question: The new algorithm improved the processing ___ of the server; consequently, energy consumption was reduced by fifteen percent.
exercises.hint: Choose the noun that refers to achieving maximum productivity with minimum wasted effort or expense.
exercises.example_sentence: The new algorithm improved the processing efficiency of the server; consequently, energy consumption was reduced by fifteen percent.

exercises.question: Match the technical verbs with their descriptive meanings.
exercises.hint: One pair is about putting a system or software into effective action; the other is about making small changes to improve something.
exercises.example_sentence: The developers need to modify the code before they can safely deploy the update to the public server.

exercises.question: Order the sentence for a tech industry report.
exercises.answer: Notwithstanding the initial software bugs the platform has become the industry standard for online collaboration
exercises.hint: Start with 'Notwithstanding' to contrast the early technical problems with the current success of the tool.
exercises.example_sentence: Notwithstanding the initial software bugs, the platform has become the industry standard for online collaboration.

exercises.question: Say 'versatility'.
exercises.hint: Stress the fourth syllable: ver-sa-TIL-i-ty. This refers to the ability to adapt or be adapted to many different functions or activities.
exercises.example_sentence: The versatility of the new tablet makes it ideal for both designers and office workers although it is quite expensive.

exercises.question: Which noun refers to the action or process of combining two or more things so that they work together effectively?
exercises.hint: Think of connecting different software systems or incorporating new technology into an old factory.
exercises.example_sentence: The integration of AI into the workflow has improved accuracy whereas it has also raised concerns about job security.

exercises.question: The company is seeking ___ growth through innovation; whereas, its rivals are focused on short-term profits.
exercises.hint: Choose the adjective that describes something able to be maintained at a certain rate or level without depleting resources.
exercises.example_sentence: The company is seeking sustainable growth through innovation; whereas, its rivals are focused on short-term profits.

exercises.question: Match the technology adjectives with their descriptive synonyms.
exercises.hint: One pair is about things that exist in software but not in the real world; the other is about things you can touch.
exercises.example_sentence: Cloud storage provides a virtual space for files, but we still need tangible hardware to access the internet.

exercises.question: Order the sentence regarding modern energy technology.
exercises.answer: The smart grid will optimize energy distribution unless the software fails to balance the load during peak hours
exercises.hint: Start with 'The smart grid' and use 'unless' to indicate the risk that could prevent optimization.
exercises.example_sentence: The smart grid will optimize energy distribution unless the software fails to balance the load during peak hours.

exercises.question: Say 'encryption'.
exercises.hint: Stress the second syllable: en-CRYP-tion. This refers to the process of converting information or data into a code, especially to prevent unauthorized access.
exercises.example_sentence: Robust data encryption is mandatory unless the information is intended for public consumption.

exercises.question: Which noun refers to the capacity of a system to be changed in size or scale to handle a growing amount of work?
exercises.hint: Think of a website that can handle 100 users or 1,000,000 users without crashing.
exercises.example_sentence: The primary advantage of cloud computing is its scalability although it can become expensive as usage grows.

exercises.question: Streaming services have been a ___ force in the entertainment industry; consequently, many traditional cinemas have closed.
exercises.hint: Choose the adjective that describes an innovation that creates a new market and value network, eventually displacing established firms.
exercises.example_sentence: Streaming services have been a disruptive force in the entertainment industry; consequently, many traditional cinemas have closed.

exercises.question: Match the technical terms with their descriptive meanings.
exercises.hint: One pair is about two things being able to work together without problems; the other is about making two things happen at the same time or speed.
exercises.example_sentence: You should synchronize your devices to ensure the data is compatible across all platforms.

exercises.question: Order the sentence for a software design review.
exercises.answer: Notwithstanding the high complexity the team successfully developed a user friendly interface that anyone can navigate easily
exercises.hint: Start with 'Notwithstanding' to contrast the difficult technical side with the simple result for the user.
exercises.example_sentence: Notwithstanding the high complexity, the team successfully developed a user-friendly interface that anyone can navigate easily.

exercises.question: Say 'obsolescence'.
exercises.hint: Stress the third syllable: ob-so-LES-cence. This refers to the process of becoming obsolete or outdated and no longer used.
exercises.example_sentence: Planned obsolescence is a controversial practice in manufacturing although it drives continuous consumer demand.

exercises.question: Which adjective describes a person who is no longer needed at a job because the job itself no longer exists?
exercises.hint: Think of what happens to workers when a factory closes or a department is automated.
exercises.example_sentence: Many staff members were made redundant although the company had reported record profits earlier in the fiscal year.

exercises.question: The young ___ started her business in a small garage; therefore, her story has become an inspiration for many aspiring tech leaders.
exercises.hint: Choose the noun for a person who sets up a business or businesses, taking on financial risks in the hope of profit.
exercises.example_sentence: The young entrepreneur started her business in a small garage; therefore, her story has become an inspiration for many aspiring tech leaders.

exercises.question: Match the corporate growth terms with their closer academic synonyms.
exercises.hint: One pair is about two companies joining to become one; the other is about one company buying another.
exercises.example_sentence: The acquisition of the smaller firm was finalized yesterday whereas the merger between the two giants is still pending approval.

exercises.question: Order the sentence regarding industrial relations.
exercises.answer: The labor union will call a strike unless the management agrees to a significant increase in the minimum wage
exercises.hint: Start with 'The labor union' and use 'unless' to describe the condition to avoid industrial action.
exercises.example_sentence: The labor union will call a strike unless the management agrees to a significant increase in the minimum wage.

exercises.question: Say 'negotiation'.
exercises.hint: Stress the fourth syllable: ne-go-ti-A-tion. This is a discussion aimed at reaching an agreement.
exercises.example_sentence: The salary negotiation was successful although both parties had to make significant concessions.

exercises.question: Which noun refers to the exclusive possession or control of the supply or trade in a commodity or service?
exercises.hint: Think of a market where there is only one seller and no competition.
exercises.example_sentence: The tech giant was accused of creating a monopoly whereas its competitors argued for a more open marketplace.

exercises.question: The country entered a deep ___ last winter; consequently, unemployment rates reached an all-time high in several provinces.
exercises.hint: Choose the noun for a period of temporary economic decline during which trade and industrial activity are reduced.
exercises.example_sentence: The country entered a deep recession last winter; consequently, unemployment rates reached an all-time high in several provinces.

exercises.question: Match the economic terms with their closer descriptive meanings.
exercises.hint: One pair is about having too little money or resources; the other is about having more than what is needed.
exercises.example_sentence: The budget surplus allowed for new social programs notwithstanding the previous year's massive deficit.

exercises.question: Order the sentence for an annual business review.
exercises.answer: Notwithstanding the challenging market conditions the corporation maintained its market share although profit margins were slightly lower
exercises.hint: Start with 'Notwithstanding' to contrast the bad market with the stable position of the company.
exercises.example_sentence: Notwithstanding the challenging market conditions, the corporation maintained its market share although profit margins were slightly lower.

exercises.question: Say 'profitability'.
exercises.hint: Stress the fifth syllable: prof-it-a-BIL-i-ty. This is the degree to which a business or activity yields profit.
exercises.example_sentence: The long-term profitability of the venture is uncertain unless the company reduces its operational overhead.

exercises.question: Which noun refers to obtaining goods or a service from an outside or foreign supplier, especially in place of an internal source?
exercises.hint: Think of a US company hiring a call center in India to handle customer service.
exercises.example_sentence: The outsourcing of IT services saved costs although it led to some communication difficulties with the offshore team.

exercises.question: Portfolio ___ is essential for minimizing risk; whereas, investing all your capital in one stock is extremely dangerous.
exercises.hint: Choose the noun that refers to the process of allocating capital in a way that reduces the exposure to any one particular asset.
exercises.example_sentence: Portfolio diversification is essential for minimizing risk; whereas, investing all your capital in one stock is extremely dangerous.

exercises.question: Match the financial terms with their descriptive academic synonyms.
exercises.hint: One pair is about money coming in; the other is about money going out.
exercises.example_sentence: Total revenue increased this quarter, but the high expenditure on new equipment limited the net profit.

exercises.question: Order the sentence regarding monetary policy.
exercises.answer: The central bank will not lower interest rates unless inflation falls below the two percent target threshold
exercises.hint: Start with 'The central bank' and use 'unless' to state the specific economic condition required for a rate cut.
exercises.example_sentence: The central bank will not lower interest rates unless inflation falls below the two percent target threshold.

exercises.question: Say 'globalization'.
exercises.hint: Stress the fifth syllable: glob-al-i-ZA-tion. This refers to the process by which businesses or other organizations develop international influence.
exercises.example_sentence: Globalization has opened new markets for local artisans although it has also increased competition from large multinationals.

exercises.question: Which noun refers to a sum of money granted by the state or a public body to help an industry or business keep the price of a commodity or service low?
exercises.hint: Think of government support for farmers or renewable energy companies.
exercises.example_sentence: The government provided a massive subsidy to the airline industry although environmental groups protested the decision.

exercises.question: A ___ is anyone who has an interest in or is affected by the activities of a business; therefore, this includes employees, customers, and the local community.
exercises.hint: Choose the noun for a person or group that has an investment, share, or interest in something, as a business or industry.
exercises.example_sentence: A stakeholder is anyone who has an interest in or is affected by the activities of a business; therefore, this includes employees, customers, and the local community.

exercises.question: Match the economic adjectives with their descriptive meanings.
exercises.hint: One pair is about a market that changes quickly and unpredictably; the other is about an economy that is not growing or showing activity.
exercises.example_sentence: The stock market remains highly volatile, but the local housing market has been stagnant for nearly three years.

exercises.question: Order the sentence for a labor market analysis.
exercises.answer: Notwithstanding the low unemployment wages have remained largely unchanged over the last decade as evidenced by the latest economic data
exercises.hint: Start with 'Notwithstanding' to contrast the good employment numbers with the lack of wage growth.
exercises.example_sentence: Notwithstanding the low unemployment, wages have remained largely unchanged over the last decade as evidenced by the latest economic data.

exercises.question: Say 'infrastructure'.
exercises.hint: Stress the first syllable: IN-fra-struc-ture. This refers to the basic physical and organizational structures needed for the operation of a society.
exercises.example_sentence: Modernizing the country's transportation infrastructure is vital for economic growth whereas the current system is outdated.

exercises.question: Which adjective describes an illness or condition that persists for a long time or constantly recurs?
exercises.hint: Think of conditions like asthma or arthritis that require long-term management.
exercises.example_sentence: The patient suffers from chronic back pain although physical therapy has helped improve his mobility significantly.

exercises.question: Early detection of ___ is crucial for effective treatment; therefore, regular check-ups are recommended for high-risk groups.
exercises.hint: Choose the noun for physical or mental features that indicate a condition or disease.
exercises.example_sentence: Early detection of symptoms is crucial for effective treatment; therefore, regular check-ups are recommended for high-risk groups.

exercises.question: Match the medical verbs with their closer academic synonyms.
exercises.hint: One pair is about making pain or a problem less severe; the other is about a condition getting progressively worse.
exercises.example_sentence: The medication helped alleviate the initial discomfort, but the patient's condition began to deteriorate shortly after.

exercises.question: Order the sentence regarding medical ethics.
exercises.answer: The surgery will not be performed unless the patient provides explicit written consent after the consultation
exercises.hint: Start with 'The surgery' and use 'unless' to describe the necessary legal and ethical condition.
exercises.example_sentence: The surgery will not be performed unless the patient provides explicit written consent after the consultation.

exercises.question: Say 'pharmaceutical'.
exercises.hint: Stress the fourth syllable: phar-ma-CEU-ti-cal. This relates to medicinal drugs or their preparation.
exercises.example_sentence: The pharmaceutical industry is heavily regulated although many companies still invest billions in research and development.

exercises.question: Which noun refers to a widespread occurrence of an infectious disease in a community at a particular time?
exercises.hint: Think of a sudden outbreak that affects many people in a specific region.
exercises.example_sentence: The health department struggled to contain the flu epidemic whereas the previous years numbers were much lower.

exercises.question: Psychological ___ helps individuals cope with stress; consequently, it is a key focus in modern mental health therapy.
exercises.hint: Choose the noun for the capacity to recover quickly from difficulties; toughness.
exercises.example_sentence: Psychological resilience helps individuals cope with stress; consequently, it is a key focus in modern mental health therapy.

exercises.question: Match the medical adjectives with their closer descriptive meanings.
exercises.hint: One pair is about traits passed from parents to children; the other is about diseases spread by contact or germs.
exercises.example_sentence: Color blindness is often hereditary, while the common cold is highly contagious.

exercises.question: Order the sentence for a medical research report.
exercises.answer: Notwithstanding the minor side effects the clinical trial was considered a success due to the high recovery rate
exercises.hint: Start with 'Notwithstanding' to contrast the small problems with the overall positive result.
exercises.example_sentence: Notwithstanding the minor side effects, the clinical trial was considered a success due to the high recovery rate.

exercises.question: Say 'rehabilitation'.
exercises.hint: Stress the fifth syllable: re-ha-bil-i-TA-tion. This is the action of restoring someone to health or normal life through training and therapy.
exercises.example_sentence: The athlete underwent intensive rehabilitation whereas many feared the injury would end his career.

exercises.question: Which noun refers to a harmless pill, medicine, or procedure prescribed more for the psychological benefit to the patient than for any physiological effect?
exercises.hint: Used often in clinical trials to compare the effectiveness of a real drug against a 'fake' one.
exercises.example_sentence: Half of the participants received the active drug while the other group was given a placebo.

exercises.question: A ___ lifestyle is a major contributor to cardiovascular disease; whereas, regular exercise significantly lowers the risk.
exercises.hint: Choose the adjective describing a way of life that involves little physical activity.
exercises.example_sentence: A sedentary lifestyle is a major contributor to cardiovascular disease; whereas, regular exercise significantly lowers the risk.

exercises.question: Match the medical analysis terms with their descriptive meanings.
exercises.hint: One pair is about figuring out what the illness is; the other is about predicting the likely course of the illness.
exercises.example_sentence: The doctor confirmed the diagnosis today, but the long-term prognosis remains uncertain.

exercises.question: Order the sentence regarding public health policy.
exercises.answer: The health crisis will not be resolved unless the government allocates more funding to primary healthcare facilities
exercises.hint: Start with 'The health crisis' and use 'unless' to state the required action.
exercises.example_sentence: The health crisis will not be resolved unless the government allocates more funding to primary healthcare facilities.

exercises.question: Say 'anesthesiologist'.
exercises.hint: Stress the sixth syllable: an-es-the-si-OL-o-gist. This is a doctor who specializes in giving drugs to make patients unconscious for surgery.
exercises.example_sentence: The anesthesiologist monitored the patients vitals closely throughout the entire four-hour procedure.

exercises.question: Which noun refers to a deeply distressing or disturbing experience, or physical injury?
exercises.hint: Can be used for both emotional shock and physical bodily harm.
exercises.example_sentence: The victim suffered severe psychological trauma although the physical wounds healed relatively quickly.

exercises.question: The study focuses on ___ development in early childhood; consequently, researchers are observing how children solve complex puzzles.
exercises.hint: Choose the adjective relating to the mental action or process of acquiring knowledge and understanding through thought, experience, and the senses.
exercises.example_sentence: The study focuses on cognitive development in early childhood; consequently, researchers are observing how children solve complex puzzles.

exercises.question: Match the health status adjectives with their descriptive meanings.
exercises.hint: One pair is about being easily affected or harmed by something; the other is about being resistant to a particular infection or toxin.
exercises.example_sentence: Older adults are more susceptible to the virus, while those who have been vaccinated are largely immune.

exercises.question: Order the sentence for a psychiatric study summary.
exercises.answer: Notwithstanding the initial skepticism the new therapy has shown remarkable results in treating patients with severe depression
exercises.hint: Start with 'Notwithstanding' to contrast the early doubts with the impressive current results.
exercises.example_sentence: Notwithstanding the initial skepticism, the new therapy has shown remarkable results in treating patients with severe depression.

exercises.question: Say 'cardiovascular'.
exercises.hint: Stress the fourth syllable: car-di-o-VAS-cu-lar. This relates to the heart and blood vessels.
exercises.example_sentence: Cardiovascular diseases remain the leading cause of death globally although many are preventable through lifestyle changes.

exercises.question: Which noun refers to laws, considered collectively, or the process of making laws?
exercises.hint: Think of the work done by a parliament or congress.
exercises.example_sentence: New legislation is required to protect digital privacy whereas current laws are outdated and insufficient.

exercises.question: The government has called for a national ___ on the new constitution; therefore, every citizen will have the opportunity to vote on the changes.
exercises.hint: Choose the noun for a general vote by the electorate on a single political question which has been referred to them for a direct decision.
exercises.example_sentence: The government has called for a national referendum on the new constitution; therefore, every citizen will have the opportunity to vote on the changes.

exercises.question: Match the legal verbs with their closer academic synonyms.
exercises.hint: One pair is about charging someone with a crime; the other is about declaring someone not guilty.
exercises.example_sentence: The state decided to prosecute the suspect, but the jury eventually chose to acquit him due to lack of evidence.

exercises.question: Order the sentence regarding the legislative process.
exercises.answer: The bill will not become law unless it is signed by the President after passing through both houses of parliament
exercises.hint: Start with 'The bill' and use 'unless' to indicate the final requirement for a law to be enacted.
exercises.example_sentence: The bill will not become law unless it is signed by the President after passing through both houses of parliament.

exercises.question: Say 'jurisdiction'.
exercises.hint: Stress the third syllable: ju-ris-DIC-tion. This is the official power to make legal decisions and judgments.
exercises.example_sentence: The local court does not have jurisdiction over this case although the crime occurred within the city limits.

exercises.question: Which noun refers to the authority of a state to govern itself or another state?
exercises.hint: Think of a country's right to make its own laws without outside interference.
exercises.example_sentence: The treaty was designed to protect national sovereignty whereas critics argued it gave too much power to international bodies.

exercises.question: The congress proposed a constitutional ___ to protect freedom of speech; consequently, a long debate broke out in the senate.
exercises.hint: Choose the noun for a minor change or addition designed to improve a text, piece of legislation, etc.
exercises.example_sentence: The congress proposed a constitutional amendment to protect freedom of speech; consequently, a long debate broke out in the senate.

exercises.question: Match the political and legal terms with their closer descriptive meanings.
exercises.hint: One pair is about a punishment for breaking a law or rule; the other is about making an agreement official.
exercises.example_sentence: The UN may impose a sanction, but all member states must first ratify the resolution.

exercises.question: Order the sentence for a political news summary.
exercises.answer: Notwithstanding the strong public opposition the government pushed through the new tax reform although it delayed the implementation date
exercises.hint: Start with 'Notwithstanding' to contrast the people's feelings with the government's final action.
exercises.example_sentence: Notwithstanding the strong public opposition, the government pushed through the new tax reform although it delayed the implementation date.

exercises.question: Say 'accountability'.
exercises.hint: Stress the fifth syllable: ac-count-a-BIL-i-ty. This is the obligation of an individual or organization to account for its activities.
exercises.example_sentence: Political accountability is essential in a democracy unless the system allows for widespread corruption.

exercises.question: Which noun refers to a body of voters in a specified area who elect a representative to a legislative body?
exercises.hint: Think of the group of people an MP or a Senator represents.
exercises.example_sentence: The politician returned to his constituency to hear their concerns although he spent most of his time in the capital.

exercises.question: International ___ is required to avoid armed conflict; whereas, aggressive rhetoric only increases tension between nations.
exercises.hint: Choose the noun for the profession, activity, or skill of managing international relations.
exercises.example_sentence: International diplomacy is required to avoid armed conflict; whereas, aggressive rhetoric only increases tension between nations.

exercises.question: Match the legal process terms with their descriptive meanings.
exercises.hint: One pair is about taking legal action in court; the other is about resolving a dispute outside of court with a neutral third party.
exercises.example_sentence: The companies chose arbitration to save time, but the unresolved issues eventually led to full-scale litigation.

exercises.question: Order the sentence regarding a legal appeal.
exercises.answer: The court will overturn the conviction unless new forensic evidence can be produced before the appeal deadline
exercises.hint: Start with 'The court' and use 'unless' to describe the condition needed to keep the guilty verdict.
exercises.example_sentence: The court will overturn the conviction unless new forensic evidence can be produced before the appeal deadline.

exercises.question: Say 'totalitarian'.
exercises.hint: Stress the fourth syllable: to-tal-i-TAR-i-an. This refers to a system of government that is centralized and dictatorial.
exercises.example_sentence: The rise of totalitarian regimes was a major theme of 20th-century history although many countries have since transitioned to democracy.

exercises.question: Which noun refers to a system of government in which most of the important decisions are taken by state officials rather than by elected representatives?
exercises.hint: Often used to describe a system with complex rules and procedures that slow down progress.
exercises.example_sentence: Small businesses often struggle with excessive bureaucracy whereas large corporations have legal departments to handle it.

exercises.question: Employers have a ___ duty to provide a safe working environment; therefore, they can be sued if they neglect safety regulations.
exercises.hint: Choose the adjective that means required, permitted, or enacted by statute (law).
exercises.example_sentence: Employers have a statutory duty to provide a safe working environment; therefore, they can be sued if they neglect safety regulations.

exercises.question: Match the political ideals with their closer descriptive meanings.
exercises.hint: One pair is about the state of being free within society; the other is about the quality of being just and impartial.
exercises.example_sentence: The constitution was designed to ensure liberty and justice for all citizens notwithstanding their background.

exercises.question: Order the sentence for a history of international relations.
exercises.answer: Notwithstanding the diplomatic efforts the two nations remained at odds over the disputed border territory for many years
exercises.hint: Start with 'Notwithstanding' to contrast the attempts at peace with the ongoing conflict.
exercises.example_sentence: Notwithstanding the diplomatic efforts, the two nations remained at odds over the disputed border territory for many years.

exercises.question: Say 'constitutionality'.
exercises.hint: Stress the sixth syllable: con-sti-tu-tion-AL-i-ty. This is the quality of being in accordance with a political constitution.
exercises.example_sentence: The Supreme Court must decide on the constitutionality of the law unless the government decides to withdraw it voluntarily.

exercises.question: Choose the correct word to complete the inversion: ___ have I witnessed such a remarkable display of technological innovation in such a short period.
exercises.hint: Inversion often follows negative or restrictive adverbs to add emphasis.
exercises.example_sentence: Seldom have I witnessed such a remarkable display of technological innovation in such a short period.

exercises.question: ___ the company to fail in its obligation to protect user data, the legal consequences would be catastrophic.
exercises.hint: Use the subjunctive 'Were' for a hypothetical 'if' condition in formal English.
exercises.example_sentence: Were the company to fail in its obligation to protect user data, the legal consequences would be catastrophic.

exercises.question: Match these nuanced adverbs with their academic synonyms.
exercises.hint: One pair describes a harmful effect; the other describes high accuracy.
exercises.example_sentence: The new regulations might adversely affect small businesses unless they are precisely implemented.

exercises.question: Order the sentence using negative inversion.
exercises.answer: Hardly had the new legislation been introduced when it was met with widespread public scrutiny and debate
exercises.hint: Start with 'Hardly' followed by the auxiliary verb 'had' to show one action following another immediately.
exercises.example_sentence: Hardly had the new legislation been introduced when it was met with widespread public scrutiny and debate.

exercises.question: Say 'unprecedented'.
exercises.hint: Stress the second syllable: un-PREC-e-dent-ed. This means never done or known before.
exercises.example_sentence: The scale of the disaster was unprecedented notwithstanding the region's history of environmental challenges.

exercises.question: Which connector indicates that two things are happening at the exactly the same time?
exercises.hint: Think of 'sync' or 'at once'.
exercises.example_sentence: The data was uploaded and encrypted simultaneously; whereas, previous systems handled these tasks separately.

exercises.question: ___ as the evidence suggests, the policy has been successful; therefore, we should consider expanding it next year.
exercises.hint: Choose the connector that means 'to the extent that'.
exercises.example_sentence: Insofar as the evidence suggests, the policy has been successful; therefore, we should consider expanding it next year.

exercises.question: Match the nuanced adverbs with their meanings.
exercises.hint: One pair describes something stated plainly; the other describes something suggested without being stated.
exercises.example_sentence: The contract explicitly forbids sharing data, although it implicitly suggests a duty of care.

exercises.question: Order the sentence for a scientific summary using 'Not only'.
exercises.answer: Not only did the study confirm the initial hypothesis but it also revealed several unforeseen long term benefits
exercises.hint: Start with 'Not only did' and remember the 'but also' structure for the second half.
exercises.example_sentence: Not only did the study confirm the initial hypothesis, but it also revealed several unforeseen long-term benefits.

exercises.question: Say 'subsequently'.
exercises.hint: Stress the first syllable: SUB-se-quent-ly. This means 'after a particular thing has happened'.
exercises.example_sentence: The error was found early and subsequently corrected before the report was published.

exercises.question: Choose the word for a conditional requirement: ___ that all safety protocols are followed, the experiment may proceed as scheduled.
exercises.hint: This is a more formal way of saying 'on the condition that'.
exercises.example_sentence: Provided that all safety protocols are followed, the experiment may proceed as scheduled.

exercises.question: The project was completed on time, ___ at a much higher cost than originally anticipated.
exercises.hint: Use this formal word meaning 'though' or 'even though' followed by a phrase.
exercises.example_sentence: The project was completed on time, albeit at a much higher cost than originally anticipated.

exercises.question: Match the connectors with their functional synonyms.
exercises.hint: One pair indicates a result; the other indicates a contrast.
exercises.example_sentence: The weather was poor; nonetheless, the event continued. Consequently, we were all very cold.

exercises.question: Order the sentence using negative inversion for emphasis.
exercises.answer: Under no circumstances should the laboratory be left unattended while the hazardous chemical reaction is taking place
exercises.hint: Start with the strong restriction 'Under no circumstances'.
exercises.example_sentence: Under no circumstances should the laboratory be left unattended while the hazardous chemical reaction is taking place.

exercises.question: Say 'fundamentally'.
exercises.hint: Stress the third syllable: fun-da-MEN-tal-ly. This means in central or primary respects.
exercises.example_sentence: The two theories are fundamentally different notwithstanding their shared history.

exercises.question: Choose the formal inversion for a past conditional: ___ the researchers known about the risks, they would have modified the protocol.
exercises.hint: This replaces 'If the researchers had known...'
exercises.example_sentence: Had the researchers known about the risks, they would have modified the protocol.

exercises.question: The region is ___ agricultural; therefore, any fluctuation in crop prices significantly impacts the local economy.
exercises.hint: Choose the adverb that means 'mainly' or 'for the most part'.
exercises.example_sentence: The region is predominantly agricultural; therefore, any fluctuation in crop prices significantly impacts the local economy.

exercises.question: Match these viewpoint adverbs with their academic meanings.
exercises.hint: One pair is about something that is claimed but not proven; the other is about something that will definitely happen.
exercises.example_sentence: The suspect allegedly stole the files, and litigation will inevitably follow.

exercises.question: Order the sentence using formal inversion.
exercises.answer: Scarcely had the news reached the public when the company stocks began to plummet dramatically
exercises.hint: Start with 'Scarcely' and remember to follow with 'had' and the subject.
exercises.example_sentence: Scarcely had the news reached the public when the company stocks began to plummet dramatically.

exercises.question: Say 'simultaneously'.
exercises.hint: Stress the fourth syllable: si-mul-TA-ne-ous-ly. This means at the same time.
exercises.example_sentence: The program allows multiple users to edit the document simultaneously.
